comment: He gets straight to the point in his lecture videos and also includes short stories to help us remember. Although he's a good professor, he reports TOO MANY people to SCAI! Just make sure you follow his rules regarding how he wants to go about the lockdown webcam browser.

He was a great lab professor!! Even with this course being 8 weeks he was very passionate and made sure you understood the material! Anatomy & Physiology is a tough course itself so it required a lot of studying but he was a great professor and very knowledgeable!

He is an ok professor. he is VERY strict for online. like for no reason at all. He reports any and everyone to SCAI if he even suspects that you're cheating in the slightest way. He has a bit of an ego when it comes to his degrees (i totally understand) so always address him by "Dr. P" or he won't respond to your email lol. take another professor.
vveryyyyy strict and reports everything to scai because he's paranoid

Good teacher with informative powerpoints, but would not recommend taking him online at ALL. Was extremely strict with webcam tests, and reported MULTIPLE students to SCAI based on his own "suspicion".

Took Professor Parente for online A&P lab and it was good. Most of the work falls on behalf of the student, so make sure to stay on top of things. He has lectures that are 10 to 20 minutes long, but he skips over slides a lot. He's strict about the lockdown browser and webcam, so make sure to follow his directions. Overall, great class.

Awesome professor! Take him if you have the opportunity! Lectures are clear, engaging, and teach the topic well. Requires some work outside the classroom, but the class is set up to help you succeed. Pay attention/show up to lecture, complete homework/practice quizzes, and scan the textbook. Create a good study plan for exams and start early!

Please take Dr. P! He is an amazing and caring teacher. He wants his students to succeed and offers a ton of extra credit!! His tests are based on the PowerPoints and those PowerPoints are super short and easy to understand/read! If you want to pass anatomy first try, take him.

Dr. Parente was a goated professor. He was such a sweet caring and mindful professor. He gave out so much extra credit. He has very good analogy's. Study the learning objectives because if you understand the LO you will do good on the tests. If you want an A in this class take Parente he is most definitely the best prof.  tests are 75% of the grade

Dr.P is hands down the best professor at KSU. Genuinely there is no professor who cares more than to see his students succeed. If I had to take AP1 all over I would choose him a 100 times over. His exams are copy paste his power points and practice quizzes and EC. TAKE HIM!!!

One of the best professors I have ever had. Although the curriculum of this class is difficult, he gave very good examples and explained the content very well so it was easier to answer. He also gave practice quizzes with every unit that helped tremendously with unit exams. As long as you attended lectures, did your homework, & studied you'll pass.

I came into this class preparing myself to struggle or fail. Parente is hands down the most caring professor I've ever had. He knows Anatomy is not an easy class, but he provides you with so many resources for a grade booster. Be prepared to study a lot, but it will genuinely help so much in future classes. Devote time and you'll see good results!!

Took A&P I with him and he made it SO easy to understand. His PPTs go over the textbook material so its important that you read the chapters before lectures. He uploads all his lectures. Attendance isn't mandatory but you get special access to participation quizzes for bonus points on test. Very nice, he is the goat
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. P is one of the most caring and invested professors you'll encounter in undergrad. A&P is naturally a very dense subject - it will require at least 1 hour a day of quality learning to succeed in the course. But speaking to Dr. P directly, he uses his judgement to decide what is the best approach for students and their future success.

LOVE HIM! Took him for lab and lecture and he was amazing. Wants to make sure you understand material and is very considerate. Will help if you ask. Class is easy enough, just pay attention and read the textbook.

Multiple weekly assignments and short quizzes. Exams were straightforward primarily on his material. His material alone is enough to pass. AP II is going to be rough but he made it manageable. I do recommend his class. He does respond to questions. His explanations were helpful.

He is really cool and funny which is nice. He explains anatomy in a way which students can actually understand and he is very thorough and makes sure you cover what you need to know and nothing else. I would 100% take him again

Honestly was so adored by so many students. My only issue was his soothing voice, I wanted to sleep. Lecture pace is also slow and more boring. But, I feel like he provided so many opportunities to boost your grade compared to other professors, like multiple attempt quizzes and homeworks. Nice guy, just slower paced, if you like that, perfect

I miss Dr.P so much and took him for granted his lectures are so engaging and all around I would take him again in a heart beat. Ya the tests are kinda hard and ya the info can be tough to learn but you picked this major so like get used to it! Also for lab he is sooo good
honestly my fav prof here at ksu. Very funny and personable. gave us 35 points ec and 200 basically free points bc hw had a bunch of attempts and so did the quizzes. exams are 70 ish questions.

This is the anatomy professor I highly recommend. I've taken him for both A&P 1 and 2, and he's fantastic. His PowerPoints are concise, making the material easy to grasp, and everything covered is on the tests. His exams are straightforward, and his lectures are clear. Plus, if you need to review, he records all his lectures.

he was honestly  a good professor but the lecture slides can be really confusing because he highlights a ton of information without much explanation, you would have to put in a lot of work to be able to get a good grade in this class, I took him summer and it was soo hard..but good luck taking him
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Great professor. He provides HW, lockdown quizzes with no camera, and extra credit. I have been studying off of just the powerpoints and his exams are exactly what is on there. I am also taking this course over the summer so it says alot. Attendance is not necessary as he provides recorded zoom videos and office hours. Truly amazing and caring

Dr. P was an amazing instructor! He was very clear in his lectures and really helped you to understand a tough course like A&P1. He was very good about giving out extra credit and providing us with ample graded assignments. His lectures were not mandatory, but I would recommend going as they make what's in the textbook more clear.

Amazing professor!! His lectures always helped me as he goes into detail. He does go through lectures fairly fast but he records everything to go back and watch later on. If you cannot attend class, he hosts a zoom. Attendance is not counted except for exam days. Gives extra credit every unit so do those quizzes!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: My only complaint is that I wish this class was harder and more competitive. It was a little too easy. But he's a good professor, explains material so that it's understood. You will be studying.

Dr. P is awesome. A&P is a hard class but he makes it as simple as possible. His lectures are great and he is direct about what you need to know for the exams. There is a lot of homework (unlimited attempts), five exams, a final, lots of quizzes, and extra credit! I bombed one exam and still had an A. Dr. P is so nice and genuinely cares. Take him!

Dr.P is AMAZING. Take him if you can!! He gives a TON of extra credit which allows you to not do as well on the tests (which you should do fine as long as you study his powerpoint) and still have a very high grade. He is the best professor for A&P. I also took him for lab and he was amazing for lab too. TAKE HIM 100%!!!!

If you are taking Anatomy I would definitely recommend Dr.P. He is very understanding and gives lots of study material to do before the exams. Dr P also gives extra credit which is awesome and really cares about you trying to get a good grade in his class.

I had Dr. P out of luck because I never checked his rating before I signed up for him. He is funny, nice and a polite person. I took SCM 2000 for him, and it was the easiest class ever. He doesn't take tests, quizzes, or exams in that class. His class was totally worth it. And I put BIOL 2221 because there was no option for SCM 2000.

Amazing lecturer. I had him for 8 week A&P I over the summer, lab and lecture. You should read the book to hear the info twice to get an A. Other than that, the reviews speak for themselves. He is organized, helpful, encouraging, very reasonable, abundantly clear in lecture material and expectations, and a very wholesome guy. TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

Parente has been the best professor I have come across since being here at KSU. He cares about his students  and will do anything to help you succeed ! He is always open to helping you out during his office hours. Parente also puts in grades quickly and responds to emails in a timely manner !

Whoever rated him a bad rating is referring to how lab exams are given no matter what professor you take- those are general rules on how every lab exam is to be given. That has nothing to do w Parente as he's just giving the exam out the way he was told to. Yes, lab is hard but it's hard no matter who you take. Just study you'll pass w an A

I have a 99.98% in the class from studying the powerpoints with notes I took of what he says during lecture. TAKING HIM AGAIN FOR A&P2. Just go to class- and LISTEN to his lectures: he elaborates on EVERY single thing in his powerpoint, knows what he's talking about (He used to be a practing doctor). Take him if you want to LEARN & get an A+

I took Dr. P for Anatomy 1 lecture and lab. I wanted to take him again for both Anatomy 2 lecture and lab, but I was only able to fit him in my schedule for lab. He is the best professor you could take for nursing Anatomy at Kennesaw. He makes what is very hard material  understandable. He truly cares about you and wants to help you succeed.

Anatomy 2 lab in general is very hard but Dr.P is an amazing professor. He is very caring and know the material well. The class in general requires a lot of work and dedication but Dr.P is there to help you through it! Definitely recommend his class!
Love Dr P so much! He's fair in his grading, knows the material and cares about his students. A++++

Anatomy is a difficult course, but Dr.P ensures we're fully prepared. He gives mock questions throughout the unit and records lectures so you can rewatch them to study. If you have the opportunity to take him, do it.

The lab is a lot harder than the lecture. Tests are given in musical chair style. You're rotating the whole time at different stations. Only 10 points extra credit that doesn't really do anything. He doesn't curve so don't expect that. Homework will take you an hour + to complete each.

Dr. P is an amazing professor. I took him for both lab & class during the summer & he was able to make the class do able. For class, if you read the book, fill out the unit learning objectives, and review the quizzes and exam review questions, you should be successful. For lab, he was very accessible and willing to answer all questions.
Great professor, his lectures are very detailed and the exams arent difficult if you study using the homework and quizzes.

Took him for lab in the summer and had a great grade. Lab exams were super stressful but he was patience and gave out everything he thought would be on the exam beforehand so you could study. If you could take him for both, I highly recommend. Exams are hard for lab but he does a pretty good job in narrowing it down. Take him if you need an A.

Took him in the summer, had a great grade. Course is a lot of work but if you put in the time, study his PowerPoints you will get a good grade. Super straightforward, holds your hand the entire way, a lot of extra credit and multiple attempts on quizzes. Super understanding, tests are not hard, I'm picky about my grades and I highly recommend him.
Dr. Parente is awesome! Cares about his students and is very helpful!

This man is the real deal yo. Before each test, go over each PowerPoint (about 2-3 per test; 4 tests total) 7-8 times and you are basically guaranteed to make an A. I WOULD LIKE TO NOTE THAT THE LAB FOR THIS CLASS IS WAY HARDER THAN THE LECTURE. Lab is more "hands on" type beat with models and labeling. Lecture is purely memorization.

Made A&P feel like a breeze. Ofc you need to study. But, if you actively listen to the lectures and go over the notes maybe twice you should be alright. This class is my highest grade this semester due to how easy he makes everything seem. Develop good study habits and youll be fine.
Professor P is amazing! He cares so much about his students and his power points are super clear. His tests are super manageable and he truly cares about his students!

Dr. P is the best professor I have ever had! I have him for A&P1 and A&P1 Lab. He cares about his students and is eager to answer questions and help. The class itself is not easy because A&P1 covers a lot of material but he is the best. He even gives us inspirational speeches sometimes because he knows it's hard but he encourages us to push through

TAKE HIM! Both lab and lecture if possible! This is a hard course and you will have to study, but he uploads all powerpoints, lecture recordings, additional resources, and more to help you pass. He truly cares about his students. he does reviews before a test

the grade is 4 tests + final, a few quizzes, and homework assignments (multiple attempts)

The class was difficult because, the tests assigned covered material we went over in biology lecture, 2-3 weeks earlier, so you HAD to read ahead to do well on them. The homework helped bring your grade up if you were failing the exams. We had only 1 extra credit opportunity at the end of the semester. Parente did his best.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Honestly Dr. P is one of the best professors I have had at KSU. Take him if you have the chance. His test are straightforward and gives extra credit.

This is not an easy A class. You need to study and use all resources available in order to understand the material and pass. Read every chapter and attend lectures. Study ahead of schedule because the material is HEAVY. Don't procrastinate because it will show in your grade. Parente is easy to talk to. Extra Credit was offered several times.
CAN'T STRESS THIS ENOUGH!! TAKE HIM

Dr. Parente is the best professor I have ever had! This is a tough course but he made it enjoyable. His tests are straight forward and he provides many study materials. He genuinely cares for teaching and his students. I cannot recommend him enough. PLEASE take him!

The best choice you can make. It's as easy as BIO2221 can get. Everything needed for his tests are literally in his PowerPoints and he offers extra credit. He explains everything super clearly and makes it as concise as possible. Incredibly caring and understanding prof. It would be a huge mistake to not take him.

If you have the option to take him, do yourself a favor and do that! Im just Absolutely amazed by how understanding this teacher is! He makes his test super straightforward and to the point. Bio cant get much easier than this!

Dr. P has been the most amazing professor I've had at KSU who cares deeply about his students and wants them all to be successful! He offers extra credit and gives amazing lectures. 10/10 would recommend him.

Dr. P is one of the best professors I have had here at KSU. He is very caring and although this class takes a lot of work, he makes it worth it. He does not give more work than what is needed and gives plenty of other things to help raise your grade along with extra credit. If you can take him, DO IT!

This is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. He tell you clearly what you need to know for exams and offers extra credit as well. The homework is a completion grade and the quizzes are great at preparing you for the exams. Strongly recommend taking him for anatomy

He is for sure one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He genuinely wants you to succeed in his class. He gives very concise lectures and powerpoints. He provides practice quizzes for exam practice. Amazing professor. TAKE HIM

YOU NEED TO TAKE HIM! This is the absolute best professor I have had at Kennesaw State. He is very understanding and truly cares about his students success. There are 5 exams and homework grades. The tests are mainly lecture based but he advises to read the book. I would take him for Anatomy two if I could. Do not miss the chance to take Parente!!

Absolutely amazing teacher! I was worried about biology 2221, but he presents the information in a clear and easy to remember way. 5 tests and a few homework grades are the only grades, but he made me feel so prepared. I would definitely take him for 2222 if he taught it!!!!
